member.name: T:Ace.HSVision.Client.Renderers.VisionToolRendererBase
member.summary: Defines the basic object responsible for rendering a vision tool in edit mode
member.remarks: The display of a vision tool when being edited is handled by this kind of object. Vision tool have no knowledge of vision tool editing or how graphical editing objects are used in the editing process for a tool. Additionally, this method also handles rendering of the results of a tool after it has executed. Renderers are also responsible for managing parameters and making sure they are valid given the rendering/display context.

member.name: M:Ace.HSVision.Client.Renderers.VisionToolRendererBase.CreateRenderer(Ace.HSVision.Client.IVisionPlugin,Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IVisionToolBase,Ace.HSVision.Client.ImageDisplay.IImageDisplayControl)
member.summary: Create a renderer object for the specified vision tool and the specified display.
member.param: The vision plugin associated with the display.
The tool for which to create the renderer.
The display against which the renderer operates.
member.returns: The created renderer or null if a renderer does not exist

member.name: T:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode
member.summary: Defines the search mode/segmentation mode for a blob analyzer operation

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.Light
member.summary: Light Segmentation
member.remarks: The Light segmentation algorithm outputs all pixels with values higher than the threshold value as blob pixels. Pixels with values below the threshold become background pixels. This mode is used for light blobs on a dark background.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.Dark
member.summary: Dark Segmentation Mode
member.remarks: The Dark segmentation algorithm is the inverse function of the Light segmentation algorithm. The Blob Analyzer outputs all pixels with values below the threshold value as blob pixels. Pixels with values above the threshold become background pixels. This mode is used for dark blobs on a light background.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.Inside
member.summary: Inside segmentation mode

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.Outside
member.summary: Outside segmentation mode

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.DynamicLight
member.summary: Dynamic Light Segmentation
member.remarks: Dynamic thresholding provides an adaptive thresholding mode, particularly useful when there are lighting variations from one instance to another. A dynamic threshold sets a percentage of the pixel distribution (histogram) to be considered as blob pixels.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.DynamicDark
member.summary: Dynamic Dark Segmentation
member.remarks: Dynamic thresholding provides an adaptive thresholding mode, particularly useful when there are lighting variations from one instance to another. A dynamic threshold sets a percentage of the pixel distribution (histogram) to be considered as blob pixels.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.DynamicInside
member.summary: Dynamic inside segmentation mode

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.DynamicOutside
member.summary: Dynamic outside segmentation mode

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.HSLInside
member.summary: HSL Inside segmentation mode

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.BlobSegmentationMode.HSLOutside
member.summary: HSL Outside segmentation mode

member.summary: The specified TransformRotation value modifies the rotation parameters of the Search process. For example, if the nominal Search is set to 45 degrees and the TransformRotation value is set to 10 degrees, the Locator will search for instances having a rotation of 55 degrees.

member.name: T:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering
member.summary: Ordering of instances of locator tool

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.Evidence
member.summary: Instances are processed and output according to their hypothesis strength, beginning with the strongest hypothesis.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.LeftToRight
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from left to right.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.RightToLeft
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from right to left.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.TopToBottom
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from top to bottom.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.BottomToTop
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from bottom to top.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.Quality
member.summary: All the instances are first processed and then they are output according to their Quality, beginning with the highest quality.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.DistanceImage
member.summary: Instances are processed and output according to their distance from a reference image coordinate, beginning with the closest.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.DistanceWorld
member.summary: Instances are processed and output according to their distance from a reference world coordinate, beginning with the closest.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstanceOrdering.ShadingConsistency
member.summary: Instances are processed and output according to their shading consistency with respect to the Model, beginning with the strongest hypothesis.

member.summary: InstanceLocation returns the location of the selected instance, in the frame of reference of the specified robot. If no robot-to-vision calibration has been carried out, InstanceLocation returns the location in the Vision frame of reference.

member.summary: Interface for accessing the identifier associated with a result object

member.name: T:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LineFinderResults
member.summary: Results of an line finder tool execution

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LineFinderResults.fitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the calculated line and the actual edges matched to the found line. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LineFinderResults.FitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the calculated line and the actual edges matched to the found line. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LineFinderResults.matchQuality
member.summary: Percentage of edges actually matched to the found line. Match Quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that edges were matched for every point along the found line. Similarly, a value of 0.2 means edges were matched to 20% of the points along the found line.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LineFinderResults.MatchQuality
member.summary: Percentage of edges actually matched to the found line. Match Quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that edges were matched for every point along the found line. Similarly, a value of 0.2 means edges were matched to 20% of the points along the found line.

member.summary: Scale factor of the selected object instance, giving its relative size with respect to its associated model. Available only when the CoordinateSystem property is set to hsLocatorWorld. Unavailable otherwise.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Scale factor of the selected object instance, giving its relative size with respect to its associated model. Available only when the CoordinateSystem property is set to hsLocatorWorld. Unavailable otherwise.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.position
member.summary: InstanceLocation returns the location of the selected instance, in the frame of reference of the specified robot. If a gripper offset has been assigned to the instance, it is automatically applied to the location. If no robot-to-vision calibration has been carried out, InstanceLocation returns the location in the Vision frame of reference.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.Position
member.summary: InstanceLocation returns the location of the selected instance, in the frame of reference of the specified robot. If a gripper offset has been assigned to the instance, it is automatically applied to the location. If no robot-to-vision calibration has been carried out, InstanceLocation returns the location in the Vision frame of reference.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.fitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the matched model contours of the selected object instance and the actual contours detected in the input image. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.FitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the matched model contours of the selected object instance and the actual contours detected in the input image. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.matchQuality
member.summary: Amount of matched model contours for the selected object instance. Match quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that 100% of the model contours were successfully matched to the actual contours detected in the input image.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.MatchQuality
member.summary: Amount of matched model contours for the selected object instance. Match quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that 100% of the model contours were successfully matched to the actual contours detected in the input image.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Integration.Tools.LocatorInstance.clearQuality
member.summary: Measure of the un-encumbered area surrounding the specified object instance. Clear quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the instance is completely free of obstacles.

member.summary: Measure of the un-encumbered area surrounding the specified object instance. Clear quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the instance is completely free of obstacles.

member.name: T:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool
member.summary: Vision tool for the multi region image histogram. Adds and analyzes histogram tools to get the multi region image histogram results.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.Offset
member.summary: Offset from the parent input link, if defined, or origin at which we throw the tool

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.SelectedHistogramIndex
member.summary: Index for the selected histogram being edited

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.ThresholdBlack
member.summary: Black sets the threshold for excluding dark pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value lower than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.ThresholdWhite
member.summary: White sets the threshold for excluding light pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value higher than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.TailWhite
member.summary: A White tail specifies the amount of light pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the light end of the histogram distribution (255). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.TailBlack
member.summary: A Black tail specifies the amount of dark pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the dark end of the histogram distribution (0). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.BilinearInterpolationEnabled
member.summary: Use the Bilinear Interpolation check box to enable bilinear interpolated sampling of the tool's region of interest. Bilinear sampling is slower than uninterpolated sampling but should always be enabled when subpixel accuracy is required.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.HistogramConfigurations
member.summary: The list of image histogram configurations

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.Origins
member.summary: The starting point for the tool execution

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.ImageHistogramsCount
member.summary: The count of the image histogram

member.summary: Add a new histogram tool configuration

member.name: M:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.AddNewHistogramConfiguration
member.summary: Add a new histogram tool configuration

member.summary: Remove the histogram configuration at the selected index.

member.summary: List of search pairs

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IArcCaliperTool.EdgeFilterHalfWidth
member.summary: Half-width of the convolution filter used to compute the edge magnitude curve from which actual edges are detected. The filter approximates the first derivative of the projection curve. The half-width of the filter should be set in order to match the width of the edge in the projection curve (the extent of the grey-scale transition, expressed in number of pixels).

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IArcCaliperTool.MagnitudeThreshold
member.summary: Magnitude threshold is used to find edges on the magnitude curve. A subpixel peak detection algorithm is applied on the region of every minimum or maximum of the curve that exceeds this threshold in order to locate edges.

member.summary: Projection mode used by the tool to detect edges.

member.summary: Specifies if bilinear interpolation is used to sample the grey-scale image.

member.summary: Is the custom sampling step enabled

member.summary: Magnitude threshold sets the threshold used to find edges on the magnitude curve. A subpixel peak detection algorithm is applied on the region of every minimum or maximum of the curve that exceeds this threshold in order to locate edges.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IImageHistogramTool.ThresholdBlack
member.summary: Black sets the threshold for excluding dark pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value lower than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IImageHistogramTool.ThresholdWhite
member.summary: White sets the threshold for excluding light pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value higher than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IImageHistogramTool.TailWhite
member.summary: A White tail specifies the amount of light pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the light end of the histogram distribution (255). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IImageHistogramTool.TailBlack
member.summary: A Black tail specifies the amount of dark pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the dark end of the histogram distribution (0). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.IImageHistogramTool.ImageSubSampling
member.summary: Use the Image Subsampling slider to set a subsampling level from 1, which means no subsampling, to 8, where a subsampled pixel represents a tile of 8 by 8 pixels in the original image.

member.summary: Use the Bilinear Interpolation check box to enable bilinear interpolated sampling of the tool's region of interest. Bilinear sampling is slower than uninterpolated sampling but should always be enabled when subpixel accuracy is required.

member.summary: Represent a LineFinder operation

member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast threshold level

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILineFinderTool.SubSamplingLevel
member.summary: Subsampling level used to detect edges that are used by the tool to generate hypotheses. High values provide a coarser search and lower execution time than lower values.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILineFinderTool.ConformityTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the conformity tolerance configuration

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILineFinderTool.MaximumAngleDeviation
member.summary: Maximum deviation relates to the deviation in angle between hypothesis and the line found by the tool. By default the Line Finder accepts a 20 degree deviation. However, the tool uses the defined MaximumAngleDeviation value to test the hypothesis and refine the pose of the found line.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILineFinderTool.PositioningLevel
member.summary: Configurable effort level of the entity positioning process. A value of 10 will provide coarser positioning and lower execution time. Conversely, a value of 100 will provide high accuracy positioning of line entities

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILineFinderTool.PolarityMode
member.summary: Selects the type of polarity accepted for finding a line. Polarity identifies the change in greylevel values along the tool's X axis, in the positive direction.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILineFinderTool.MinimumLinePercentage
member.summary: Minimum percentage of line contours that need to be matched for a line hypothesis to be considered as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILineFinderTool.SearchMode
member.summary: Specifies the method used by the tool to select a hypothesis.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether memory should be optimized while running.
member.value: true if memory is to be optimized; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Identifier of the underlying trained model

member.summary: Has the model been trained

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.Offset
member.summary: Offset from the parent input link, if defined, or origin at which we throw the tool

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.SearchRegion
member.summary: The rectangular area to search

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.OriginOffset
member.summary: The position in the world coordinate system of the selected model's origin. The origin, defined by the ModelOriginPositionX, ModelOriginPositionY , and ModelOriginRotation properties, is used by the Locator to express the pose of instances of the model. The translation of the instance represents the position of the model's origin in the coordinate system selected by the CoordinateSystem property. The model's origin is also used as the pivot point around which the rotation of the instance is measured. This origin also defines the object coordinate system that can be used to express results of model-based inspection tools.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.AutomaticLevels
member.summary: When set to True, this property specifies that the Outline and Detail coarseness levels were automatically optimized while building the model. When False, the Outline and Detail coarseness levels were configured manually before building the model.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.OutlineLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Outline level.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.DetailLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Detail level.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.ContrastThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast threshold level

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.FeatureSelection
member.summary: The mode used to select model features from the detected contours at both the Outline and Detail levels.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.OutlineModelDisplay
member.summary: Is the outline model being displayed

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorModel.ExecuteOnModelImage
member.summary: Does the tool execute on the model image or the newest input buffer image

member.summary: Handle to the results

member.summary: Locator Model ID

member.name: T:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool
member.summary: Represent a locator operation

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ImageSource
member.summary: The vision input source for the vision tool

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.Models
member.summary: The vision input source for the vision tool

member.name: E:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ModelCollectionChanged
member.summary: An event raised when the model collection changes.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ContrastThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast threshold level

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ContourDetection
member.summary: Sets how the contour detection parameters are configured. When set to hsContourParametersAllModels, the contour detection parameters are optimized by analyzing the parameters used to build all the models. When set to hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters are set manually. When set to a value greater than hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters of a specific model are used. The contour detection parameters on which this property has an effect are DetailLevel, OutlineLevel, ContrastThresholdMode, and ContrastThreshold

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ModelDisambiguationEnabled
member.summary: When set to True (default), the Locator applies disambiguation to discriminate between similar models and between similar hypotheses of a single object. When set to False, the Locator does not apply disambiguation.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ModelOptimizerEnabled
member.summary: Model optimization enabled

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.PercentageOfPointsToAnalyze
member.summary: Percentage of points to analyze

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ContrastPolarity
member.summary: Selects the type of polarity accepted for object recognition. Contrast polarity identifies the direction of change in greylevel values between an object and its surrounding area. Polarity is always defined with respect to the initial polarity in the image on which the Model was created.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.InstanceOrdering
member.summary: Order in which the instances are processed and output.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.MinimumClearance
member.summary: When MinimumClearPercentageEnabled is set to true, MinimumClearPercentage sets the minimum percentage of the model bounding box area that must be free of obstacles to consider an object instance as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.MinimumRequiredFeatures
member.summary: Minimum percentage of required features that must be recognized in order to consider the object instance as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.OutputSymmetricInstances
member.summary: When set to true, all the symmetric pose of the object instances are output. If False, only the best quality of the symmetric poses of the object instance is output.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.PositioningLevel
member.summary: Configurable effort level of the instance positioning process. A value of 0 will provide coarser positioning and lower execution time. Conversely, a value of 10 will provide high accuracy positioning of object instances.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.RecognitionLevel
member.summary: Configurable effort level of the search process. A value of 0 will lead to a faster search that may miss instances that are partly occluded. Conversely, a value of 10 is useful for finding partly occluded objects in cluttered or noisy images, or for models made up of small features at the Outline Level.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.SearchBasedOnOutlineLevelOnly
member.summary: When set to True, the Locator does not use the models at the Detail level for the positioning process. This mode can be used to improve the speed when only a coarse positioning of object instances is required

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.Timeout
member.summary: Time (in milliseconds) after which the Locator tool aborts its search process. This timeout period does not include the model learning phase. When the timeout is reached and TimeoutEnabled is set to True, the instances recognized up to the timeout are output by the Locator and the search is aborted.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ConformityTolerance
member.summary: Maximum number of object instances that are searched for in the input grey-scale Image. All of the object instances respecting the search constraints are output, up to a maximum of MaximumInstanceCount . They are ordered according to the InstanceOrdering property

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.OverlapConfiguration
member.summary: Maximum number of object instances that are searched for in the input grey-scale Image. All of the object instances respecting the search constraints are output, up to a maximum of MaximumInstanceCount . They are ordered according to the InstanceOrdering property

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.MaximumInstanceCount
member.summary: Maximum number of object instances that are searched for in the input grey-scale Image. All of the object instances respecting the search constraints are output, up to a maximum of MaximumInstanceCount . They are ordered according to the InstanceOrdering property

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.MinimumModelPercentage
member.summary: Minimum percentage of model contours that need to be matched in the input image in order to consider the object instance as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.NominalRotation
member.summary: Specifies whether the rotation of a recognized instance must fall within the range set by MinimumRotation and MaximumRotation or be equal to the nominal value set by the NominalRotation property. When NominalRotationEnabled is set to True, the nominal value is applied, otherwise the range is used.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.NominalScaleFactor
member.summary: Required scale factor for an object instance to be recognized.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.ShowModelName
member.summary: Required scale factor for an object instance to be recognized.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Tools.ILocatorTool.SerializedInstanceView
member.summary: Gets or sets the serialized instance view.

member.name: T:Ace.HSVision.Server.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration
member.summary: Locator Contour detection parameter configuration

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.parametersBasedOn
member.summary: Sets how the contour detection parameters are configured. When set to hsContourParametersAllModels, the contour detection parameters are optimized by analyzing the parameters used to build all the models. When set to hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters are set manually. When set to a value greater than hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters of a specific model are used. The contour detection parameters on which this property has an effect are DetailLevel, OutlineLevel, ContrastThresholdMode, and ContrastThreshold

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.ParametersBasedOn
member.summary: Sets how the contour detection parameters are configured. When set to hsContourParametersAllModels, the contour detection parameters are optimized by analyzing the parameters used to build all the models. When set to hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters are set manually. When set to a value greater than hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters of a specific model are used. The contour detection parameters on which this property has an effect are DetailLevel, OutlineLevel, ContrastThresholdMode, and ContrastThreshold

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.outlineLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Outline level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.OutlineLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Outline level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise.

member.name: F:Ace.HSVision.Server.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.detailLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Detail level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.Server.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.DetailLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Detail level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.ArcFinderResults_FitQuality
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Normalized average error between the calculated arc or line entity and the actual edges matched to the found entity. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to Conformity Tolerance..

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.ArcFinderResults_FitQuality_DisplayName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Fit Quality.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.ArcFinderResults_Found
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Found specifies if an entity was found. If True , then at least one entity (point, line or arc) was found in the current image..

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.ArcFinderResults_Found_DisplayName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Found.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.ArcFinderResults_MatchQuality
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Percentage of edges actually matched to the found entity (point, arc, or line). MatchQuality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that edges were matched for every point along the found entity. Similarly, a value of 0.2 means edges were matched to 20% of the points along the found entity..

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.ArcFinderResults_MatchQuality_DisplayName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Match Quality.

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.LineFinderResults_FitQuality
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Normalized average error between the calculated arc or line entity and the actual edges matched to the found entity. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to Conformity Tolerance. .

member.name: P:Ace.HSVision.PropertyGrid.LineFinderResults_MatchQuality
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Percentage of edges actually matched to the found entity (point, arc, or line). MatchQuality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that edges were matched for every point along the found entity. Similarly, a value of 0.2 means edges were matched to 20% of the points along the found entity..
